page.title: 02Barrington village 2
page.content: There is an area of woodland to the west of the church mainly stock with young trees as Dutch elm disease decimated it in recent years. Young horsechestnut and oak trees have been planted alongside the greens. There is a natural pond near the intersection of the Foxton Road and the High Street. At the Orwell Road end of the green there is another pond made in recent years by widening the brook. Both have families of ducks. A village sign was erected in the early 1980s. The old congregational chapel was built in 1856. It was bought in 1977 by John Brigrell & Co after being derelict for 8 years and eas converted into a luxury 3 storey house. As there is no garden space an indoor garden has been created on the ground floor - tinted glass, potted plants and a fountain in a water lily pond.
